Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torsten_SC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in Berlin. Great service, breakfast, location. I would stay there anytime again. Go. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: john w
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival in the hotel we were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise. As it was my wifes birthday the receptionist arranged for a card and cake to be sent up to our room within minutes of us checking in which we thought was a nice touch. The suite itself ws superb- spacious and well furnished. On our first night and to celebrate my wifes birthday, we ate in the `First Floor` restaurant-what an experience ! The food and service was magnificent and made for a very memorable night. The breakfast served in the hotel was also extremely good. There was a good choice of both hot and cold food. The food was distinguised by its freshness and the staff were helpful and friendly.We were able to walk into the restaurant without having to queue which is not always the case even in five star hotels. We visited the leisure centre on a number of occasions which was very enjoyable. The only problem with the centre was that the jacuzzi is actually part of the pool which means it is filled with pool water at pool temperature. It is usually better if the jacuzzi is seperately heated. That being said, the centre was of a high standard and well worth visiting. The hotel is well positioned in Berlin. It is close to both U-bahn and S-bahn stations and there is a bus stop virtually outside the hotel. This made getting around berlin very easy. All in all this was a first class hotel in a first class location. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were made to feel welcome which is very important in any hotel. We shall certainly be staying in the hotel Palace on our return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite yet”
Reviews.Author: G-dog26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, mostly for a conference. It's a well-run, clean hotel with a sumptuous breakfast buffet and excellent conference support. But the place is under a floor-by-floor renovation, and I stayed in a not-yet-renovated room. It was certainly clean, and big enough. But the furnishings are, in fact, in need of a good upgrade -- I would not be surprised if the decor was in place before the Wall fell. And to get to my floor, I had to take one elevator, hike one km, then take another to my floor, then another good walk. So for a spoiled American, it was a bit of a steeplechase to get to my room each time. Internet connectivity is expensive, at EUR 20 per day, but reliable. But the Hotel Palace makes up for this inconvenience (they use a third-party provider and can't control the cost) with a voluptuous breakfast buffet that includes more than six kinds of cheese, six kinds of sausage, lovely soft-scrambled eggs, and the usual mix of sweet and savory choices that Germans (and others) love to consume before starting the day. If you can get a renovated room, stay here. But if you can't, you may want to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel to stay, dont miss it”
Reviews.Author: EBSerb
Reviews.Content: very good hotel to stay, dont miss it I really can say that this hotel is very very worth to stay.... Except a very good room and service, food is amazing... The only thing that I can complain is too expencive internet... 24 euros per day... sorry I am not gonna pay it... +9 euro per device for wifii... no way :0))

Reviews.Title: “O.K. experience”
Reviews.Author: Edobrov
Reviews.Content: During the IHIF conference in Berlin, I had the chance to stay at Hotel Palace Berlin. The location, without any doubt, is perfect. It was 5 min from the IHIF conference. Furthermore, the breakfast was amazing, and the ambience in the lobby was warming and welcoming. The staff is friendly and approachable. The concierge gave good tips regarding the dining venues. Above are all the pluses, the drawbacks, and probably the reasons why I gave an average rating are as follows: --> overpriced internet access, with only two options: 24hrs vs 1hr --> the rooms are not five star material, I stayed in several, and the one where I stayed were not up to 5 star standards, however I must admit that my colleague stayed in a better room, which was located in a different wing of the building --> Finally, I had the view into the internal side of the building

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location, appropriate price”
Reviews.Author: Nazim S
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I visited this hotel, and had some hesitations. But now I can assure you that this is a good hotel situated in the shopping heart of Berlin. The service is very good and the price is acceptable. During my stay only one factor was negative - ongoing constructions around the hotel. But it not depends on the hotel and soon or late it will be finished. I surely recommend the hotel for those who like luxury style for an appropiate price.

Reviews.Title: “Solid experience”
Reviews.Author: aszanti
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and professional. In the room it turned out the hotel is still in "winter mode" therefore the only possibility to reduce the temperature was to open the window. And Budapesterstrasse is not a small country road... But by the end of the day the stay was OK. They have a nice and well equipped gym, swimming pool and SPA. Breakfast arrangements are among the best I have experienced within last 6 months of travels ;-). Including Blins with caviar... ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irina P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the former West Berlin. Nearby is the famous shopping street - Kurfürstendamm. Directly opposite - the Berlin Zoo (which unfortunately did not go). Rooms at large, clean, comfortable. Large bathroom, extra toilet. The hotel has two restaurants. Many staff, if necessary, they are good help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Great shopping and restaurants nearby as well as transportation. You have to try the Spa! excellent massage therapy Great and very discreete service. The hotel is located right next to Europa Center and it is very close to the train-station

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana I
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through their website. Due to unknown reasons my standard double room was upgraded to Deluxe, which was really very nice of them. Good breakfast as usual, and excellent service especially comparing to Intercontinental hotels. The hotel is a bit pricey but considering its location and service it's worth the money spent. The only thing I personally don't like is when they reserve the amount of your stay plus 100 euro on extra charges. In case you choose to pay cash it takes time to unblock the reserved sum.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than it looks from the outside...”
Reviews.Author: homerobscura
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times now and it is a lovely hotel. Breakfast is vast and extremely tasty and the rooms are very comfortable and well presented. Bathrooms are spacious and well appointed and the beds are very comfortable. It is well situated opposite the zoo/aquarium and stands over the popular Europa Centre. The staff here are all very polite, courteous and extremely helpful as you would expect at a 5 star establishment. The gym is also well appointed with basic freeweights as well as machines and the pool is clean and very relaxing with the additional artwork on the walls. All in all a very good hotel and a good comfortable base to explore Berlin...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Petesyd2204
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mother in early December 2011. The hotel was recommended by our travel agent due to its location and inclusion. We had a twin room at the rear of the hotel overlooking the shopping centre next door. The room was a excellent size with a large and modern bathroom. The rate included buffet breakfast, one of the best buffet breakfasts I have had - excellent variety. The hotel is centrally located, easy access to the trains and an easy walk to the shopping street. I have no trouble recommending the hotel to family and friends. As we were staying in the hotel in the lead up to Christmas, it was nicely decorated. They staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Raj T
Reviews.Content: Not posh but my room was very comfortable with nice shower. Didn't find many interesting restaurants in the immediate area. Berlin zoo right near hotel. Service I would describe as courtious. Very convenient connections to all sightseeing in Berlin..bus 100 right outside the hotel and the subway right round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Leading Hotel ... rooms may vary”
Reviews.Author: tripbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on NYE. The hotel is clearly extremely well managed and staffed, with everyone very friendly and helpful. You never had to wait more than a few seconds for a lift. Common areas were good - the lobby with deep sofas and scattered books was welcoming and a great place to relax and meet up. I enjoyed the calm of the bar, and the great pianist, after walking through the war-zone that is Berlin on NYE. There were always sweets or fruit or doughnuts (berliners?) at reception, and the receptionist and concierge were very helpful with suggestions and advice. You certainly feel special here, as a guest. The breakfast buffet, included in the room price, was truly awesome, and I'd recommend it to non-guests too, since the breakfast room has a lovely view over the zoo. I didn't try out the pool/spa but staff pointed it out to me in case I wanted to use it. I had a single room which was disappointing in two ways: the woodwork (especially the desk area) was chipped and looked cheap, and there were hardly any electric sockets, particularly by the desk. I had to shift the heavy desk and unplug the TV to plug in my laptop, and there was no sensible place to plug in the room kettle apart from putting it on the floor which didn't seem particularly safe. That, and the high cost of internet access (17 euros a day for leisure use, higher for business) led me to believe that the hotel needs a redesign to cater properly for the digital age. Apart from that the room was great - comfortable, clean, well-equipped - and I slept well. I would happily stay again, certainly for the price we paid which was a steal for NYE (booked a couple of months in advance). I would, however, try to have a better plan for data access. My mobile wifi provider had let me down, and I refused to pay 17 euros for in-room internet access, so I felt a bit isolated from the digital world. If your company is paying, fine. If not, investigate alternatives in advance.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions good”
Reviews.Author: sunworshipInverness
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks very upmarket when you enter the hotel. Lovely reception area and friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were good and servicing and cleaning of rooms excellant. However, the tv and radio channels constantly cut out for up to 10 seconds at a time every few minutes very annoying. Shower screen did not shower soaking bathroom floor. Bar prices very expensive, serving very cheap beer, Berliner Pilsner, not very good, and charging a fortune for a small glass. Breaksfast was excellant if wanted cold options but hot options were slow to be replenished there was a very long wait for eggs as cooked each order individually and the toaster was the slowest I have ever come across, however when food arrived was very good. Beware there are prostitutes working in reception area late at night, not sure why staff do not stop this. The location of the hotel is very good, right across the road from Berlin zoo, 5 minutes walk from Kudamn and train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Whisked_Away_8
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Hotel Palace Berlin in early December. The rooms were lovely and clean, and staff were really helpful. I would definitely stay again if travelling to Berlin. The breakfasts were absolutely amazing. So much to choose from, everything was fresh and topped up on a regular basis. The hotel was right across the road from the zoo. I didn't visit but imagine some travellers would see this as a positive. It was also very close by to department stores and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: JP_Tervuren
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Nov. and my verdict would be one of the best hotels in Europe! Just spotless except one minor thing which I will mention later on. Staff at the front desk were superb. Check-in and out were very quick and pleasent. Hotel Concierge Service did its best to find out a local resturant for us on busy Friday evening. I think he made more than 5 calls to get a table for us. Spa facilities inclduing swimming pool were excellent. My daughter, 2.5 years old, was able to swim with armbands by herself for the 1st time! Just one minor comment. My wife told me the restaurant on lobby wasn't that good. Kids menu was a bit disppointing. However this is a just minor point considering all the services we had at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: k l
Reviews.Content: Swimming pool was great! Staff was very good. Location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfortable room, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: loudons4
Reviews.Content: We stayed nights.. The room was modern, large and well furnished/equipped. The breakfast choice and food quality was excellent. The location was convenient at the Zoologisher Garten, one end of the Tiergarten park. The reception, housekeeping and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again. Free WIFI Internet would have been appreciated but no hotel is ever perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style with character”
Reviews.Author: oreganoItaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 30 years ago and remembered it as a slightly formal stylish hotel this remains the case.On the plus side I had a large bedroom as a single.Their only 4 nights for 3 was a good deal.The breakfast is great. Their is free internet on one computer in the lobby.All staff were very helpful and well trained.Is trying to create a slightly formal up market atmosphere and they do it well.You get an evening turn down service seldom seen these days.The pool is pleasant and has good changing facilities.The location is great. On the downside the hotel is part of the Euorpa center and the heating cooling system is part of this rather old fashioned building.You have to open the window if the room is too hot.Fortunately the room was quiet so that was not too much of a problem. I stayed here for 4 nights and for the 5th moved to the cheaper H10 hotel nearby the rooms there were tiny but it did have free wi fi and super rain Forrest showers in the rooms. Overall if you want an upmarket environment large rooms and atmosphere this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Angela C
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay, the location was good, the breakfast was amazing a great variety of fruit, fish, meat and other lovely things to eat. The room was very good, clean, enough space and an excellent service. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone for a visit to Berlin. The only negative thing was the noise when opening a window but that's something you'll find anywhere if you are in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: aygen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Berlin Palace during a congress in November. The frist impression was a bit disappointing. The public areas need modernization. I had one of the renovated rooms and it was very well decorated and spacious. There is a very big spa, but unfortunately I didn`t have the time to try it. What distinquished this hotel was the overall service and the food. We ate dinner once at Sam`s and once in Lounge Bar with live piano music. Each time the service, the food & the ambiance was great. The breakfast was very rich in selection and delicious. There is also a gourmet restaurant at the hotel and is very famous, but the quality of food was not limited by this restaurant. Overall the food & beverage was great. Every single employee was very friendly and service oriented. 8 days after my stay I realized that I forgot a very precious belonging in the room. I had no hope that I will get it back, but they found it and sent back to me. Overall the best service I have ever got in Germany! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “60th Birthday surprise - hotel disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MerleneSomerset
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel very good and hotel as expected for a 5* hotel plus excellent breakfast choices. Found staff indifferent and unhelpful. Room small and too dark to read so requested an additional lamp which did not arrive. Air con not working and was told it was due to the drop in temperature outside - so staff unlocked window. Booked this hotel as it had a spa and was disappointed I had to pay an extra 30euros to use it. No where in the hotel amendities description did it say there would be extra costs.

Reviews.Title: “All went very good”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris P
Reviews.Content: All very ok. A little noise from near room from television. But this hotel i recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not great and very expensive for not much”
Reviews.Author: CathrynSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: The location is great and they have a running map available for joging routes nearby. The service was terrible - ineficient and not helpful. The gym has two treadmills - no where near enough for this size hotel. The suite had too small singloe beds with really tiny duvets. The conference room we worked in was very hot (end october?) The equipment was all rented in and staff had no idea how to assist with proxima's and the like. Food ran out at the buffet and took ages to be replaced. I'm still waiting for the cappuchino I asked for at breakfast. Generally I would not use for business again. Pity for such a fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “great location, good standard”
Reviews.Author: lenemike
Reviews.Content: With about 150 others I took part in a three day conference at the Palace Hotel. Apart from the lack of tea bags (!) and instant coffee in the room - a bit strange since there was an electric kettle in the cupboard - there was nothing to complain about. The food was good, the staff were helpful and the location - next to the Europa Center and five minutes from the Bahnhof Zoo - was great. I would recommend the hotel for such relatively large events.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dan251984
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite Berlin hotel, not just for its ideal location in one of the most central parts of the city but also for the comfort. It's a typical 5 star - great breakfast, friendly staff, comfortable rooms and on occasion a dude playing the baby grande piano in the lobby. You might even spot a famous face or two during your stay as I did. I was there on business but would definitely return for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, breakfast extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: SashaRumyantsev
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently located right next to the Zoo and Kurfurstendamm. It's near flawless in every other aspect. As some other reviewer stated, it's good quality German product. The one thing that I found really spectacular was the breakfast - it was just so rich in choices and tasty, I think it's the best hotel breakfast I've ever encountered (and I've been to quite a few hotels around the world). What I found a bit annoying is the fact that the hotel is so big and I got a room at the very end of a very long corridor, so it took like 5 minutes to just walk from the lifts to my room, making a couple of turns here and there on the way. Overall it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel & Dimed (except for breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: luciesdad
Reviews.Content: Across from the wonderful Berlin Zoo, this place is integrated into a shopping mall housing restaurants catering to folks on bus tours and T-shirt shops. 9€/day for Internet service. Ate one meal there: a so-called "steak" and two beers were 45€. There 3 nights; no maid service on night 3. 770€, all in. Those negatives notwithstanding, the place was very clean and the "free" breakfast service rivals those anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: nidabloom
Reviews.Content: Booked at midday to arrive at 2pm. Got two adjoining rooms, each with two single beds - all as requested. Staff were extremely attentive and friendly. We were checked up on in regards to anything extra we may need (even though everything was already there!), which hasn't happened to us too often while travelling. The reception team were eager to help and always had an answer (and if not, researched and quickly did!). Buffet breakfast....on the joy! Thank you for a fantastic stay - it was definitely the most relaxing accommodation during our whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palace keeps going strong”
Reviews.Author: Tygrys
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hotel Palace number of times over the last 10+ years. My recent visit confirmed that the high standards are still maintained. The rooms are nice and practical and the whole place has quality feel. Hotel Palace is very well-maintained. Breakfast room is very busy and it has a feel of an airport or train station. I understand that in such a large hotel this is unavoidable during peak hour. Hotel Palace offers excellent value for money. It is not a luxury hotel but it is a solid, quality German product. It is a good base if you want to stay in Western Center. The only negative remark I have concerns extra charge for sauna. I have used the excellent spa area in the past but I did not visit it this time. However, I noted in the price list that one should pay extra for sauna. I find this weird. In a place like this, sauna usage should be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - I will be going back”
Reviews.Author: TEDF81
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed at. On arrival we were greeted with very friendly and helpful staff. They were very good when it came to giving directions and also giving advice on where to go. The room was very nice and was extremely comfortable. Location wise, it is right in the centre so it is ideal for seeing all the sights and you are very close to restaurants. I would recommend going to Vapiano's , very close to the hotel, well priced with amazing food. The hotel has a very nice indoor pool and a good spa area, which adds to the quality of this hotel. I have been to a number of 5 star hotels, and this hotel has the best breakfast service with a good selection of excellent food. This is certainly a 5 star hotel and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, should be No. 1”
Reviews.Author: BigBriFM
Reviews.Content: I can only assume that the rest of the hotels in Berlin are perfect as this is rated 39th on Tripadvisor but i couldn't fault it at all, it could/should be the No.1 hotel in Berlin. Fanastic rooms, service, pool, bar, i could go on. There was nothing i could see to fault, and even the location was good, near the zoo and the S-Bahn. If you stay in Berlin, stay here, i can't believe you'll get better value for money or service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stanrrman
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. Easy to get there via local transportation and close to " high end " shopping. but walk the other way and you will find more local restaurants at more reasonable prices. Bus stop is only half a block away to to get you down to all tourist sites. I wish the hotel would provide at no cost computer access to check-in to airlines for departure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay Despite Hard Bed”
Reviews.Author: wingate
Reviews.Content: For some reason people seem to indulge in a debate about the star rating of a hotel.My experience on the continent is that a 4star is often equivalent to a 3star in UK and 5star equivalent to a 4star.Apart from a couple of matters i very much enjoyed my stay at the Palace.I was on my own and i had a very reasonable size room and well appointed bath room.However the bed was too hard for me and i cannot say that i slept too well.The staff were fine.However there was one day when i went back to my roomat 830am after breakfast only to find a chambermaid cleaning the room.I told her she would have to come back later.She had opened the bedroom window.I assumed she would close it.However when i was going to leave today i found it was still open.Luckily it was not a warm night last night as it would have negated the effect of the air con.The breakfast was marvellous and the location was just right.So if you like or dont mind hard beds this is certainly the hotel for you.By the way i am typing this on the pc terminal which hotel guests can use for free..

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Enjoy the excellent service”
Reviews.Author: EdwardLAuckland
Reviews.Content: After Miami, this was bliss. Clean, helpful and in the right spot for the Zoogarten, memorial church and Kurfurstendamm. 25 minute walk to the old wall and 30 minutes to the Reichstag. Very modern and comfortable rooms Above all the service was excellent. It's worth paying for the spa treatment package. Sitting next to the pool in my bathrobe, after having my back done, with an apple tea. Mentioned that this tea wasn't in my room. The apple tea and other fruit teas were in my room by the time I got back, with an apology note!! Front desk asked how my day went, I mentioned that I had sore feet from walking around, and a few minutes later someone turned up with a napkin full of crushed ice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and not recommended”
Reviews.Author: viking005
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Hotel Palace Berlin in June 2010. The most attractive features of this hotel are its superb location and the excellent breakfast. Besides these, unfortunately, nothing is perfect, which at the end made us very disappointed and ranked this hotel into the not recommended category. The hotel is located very close to the Zoologischer Garten which is a perfect starting point to discover Berlin. The hotel building is neither nice nor impressive from outside because it is a big concrete building. Our standard room was relatively big but not huge with oldish furnitures, several of them showing wears and tears. The view from our room was somewhat depressing as we saw the wall of another building. In general the room was comfortable, although the bed was made of two mattresses with a notable gap between them. The bathroom was quite big, it had both a shower and a tub. However, we experienced several problems with the bathroom, which should not occur in a hotel, which tries to sell itself as a five star hotel. First, the ventilation in the bathroom was either not working or was very ineffective. Although I asked the reception to do something with it, they did not do anything. Second, the water was continuously flowing in the toilet at a slow but steady rate. Finally, the door of the shower was not closing properly, so if the shower was oriented in the wrong direction, all the water was ending up on the floor of the bathroom. The staff was generally nice and helpful, but there was one guy at the reception, who was just rude. The breakfast buffet is great, a huge selection of high quality food is offered, we really liked it. However, we sometimes experienced that the staff is simply not numerous enough in the busiest hours to remove used plates and clean tables quickly. We were very surprised about the prices of additional services at this hotel: the minibar prices are sort of expensive, movies for 16 Euros are overpriced, but the fact that they try to charge 22 Euros per day or 88 Euros per week for internet is simply arrogant! I think the managers of this hotel did not recognize that if they charge a lot of money for some service, it does not mean automatically that it will be exclusive or outstanding. In our opinion this hotel is very far from being a five star hotel, we have already stayed in much nicer four star hotels in Germany. If you are looking for a hotel in Berlin, I would suggest to either go for a decent four star hotel in the neighborhood (there are many!) or go for a real (!) five star hotel, which is also available in the direct neighborhood of this hotel. Thus, we do not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, good location for shopping, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: suzannedc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location for shopping. Some of the staff were very nice and helpful, especially in the lobby bar and housekeeping. The breakfast is a really fantastic buffet with enormous variety in a very large room upstairs. The problem is that this hotel describes itself as 5 star, and it will be seriously disappointing for many people. The best way to describe the problem with this hotel: for every good thing you want to say, there is unfortunately something very unpleasant that you also need to say. It is not near the quality of the 5 star hotels in Berlin, several of which are legendary, and most of which are plush and treat their guests with a care and style that makes the experience distinct and special. In the immediate area, there are three 4-star hotels which are more impressive and easier to recommend. To describe this hotel: it is in a rather unattractive concrete building, but the lobby has a pretty bar and a lovely living room area. There is a whiff of kitsch or strange taste here and there, and some of the front desk staff can be a bit rough, and heard speaking to guests in a way you might not expect from even a very modest hotel. It is a shame as some of the other staff are pleasant and helpful, and some younger staff at the desk are eager to please, if not fully comfortable in their jobs. In general there is a lack of polish and professionalism you would expect from a hotel of several stars. My room was very large, but had pronounced stains on the carpet and also on the upholstery. But there was a very thorough cleaning crew each day, and also a supervising housekeeper who came to check that all was properly cleaned. I thought the bathroom was very clean, and the amenities were good. Although breakfast was a very impressive buffet, it is not an elegant experience, but more like a chaotic lunchroom with wait staff rushing to get coffee and maintain the tables. Staff start taking the buffet away bang on time, and if guests arrive ten minutes late you can watch them reaching for food at the same time that the staff are removing it essentially from their grasp. We wondered if during the holidays they employ untrained temp staff? We also saw a chef throwing food away into a bin, in full view of late-arriving guests (a few minutes late) who were told the meal was finished so they would have to see what they might be able to grab. I suppose many luxury hotels would have staff that graciously apologize and maybe intercede to try to help the guest put some food on a plate, especially if there are many other guests still eating, and the arrival is just a few minutes past the finish of the food service. The concierge staff were unavailable to make restaurant suggestions and reservations (the telephone was usually busy and they were not always present at the desk or contactable) and tickets for events were a bit misunderstood. The spa looked nice, though I believe there were fees to use much of it. In sum I think you could say this is a 4-star hotel in a good position for shopping, and with an indoor spa pool and very clean rooms, a very good lobby bar and living area, but uneven staff and rooms, and a strange atmosphere, all of which could make your stay a little unpleasant, unfortunately. It is probably not necessary to stay at this hotel, as there are several very impressive and well-reviewed 4 star hotels which will provide a much nicer and more polished experience. Just in case it is important, internet was not free, and rather extremely expensive-- it may have been 20 euros or more per day. In all fairness many luxury hotels charge for internet, but here the price was especially steep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: RunningCanuck
Reviews.Content: My husband, five year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Palace from June 6th to 8th, 2011. We enjoyed the pool and fitness facility as well as our overall stay. The rooms are a good size and the bathrooms have a tub and separate shower. The breakfast at the Hotel Palace is fantastic - everything from deli meats, cheeses to omelettes, fruit salad and cereals. The Hotel Palace is located directly across from the Zoo and close to Tiergarten for scenic runs in the park. On the other side of the hotel are shops galore. We rented bikes at the shop next door to see most of the sites in the city. The staff at the hotel were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “When is a Five Star a Five Star”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of things that make a five star a five star - and the Palace has some but not others. Service is excellent. But the other amenities and features just fall short. Like the first bedroom where the aircon was broken. Or the second room which was much smaller than the first. Fixtures were a little dated which was actually a bit charming. A decent breakfast, but not as good as that of the nearby three-star Ambassador, which I would recommend over the Palace readily (particularly if paying on one's own). This place is slightly more posh than a 4 star, but it is a bit inconsistent, and expensive relative to the area. Internet deal is not a positive, either.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Flemming_Meineche
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in Berlin shopping and just plain relaxing. The hotel in itself is not particularly spectacular, but has a super location if shopping is the thing. Similarly the room was nice but also nothing special for a hotel in this category. For instance we had problems getting the aircon to work properly and in the end had to open a window to have it sufficiently cold. That said, the staff is helpfull out of the ordinary - we arrived in Berlin without having anything planned but they helped us with big enthusiasm in getting something planned. All requests were answered without you in any way feeling awkward

Reviews.Title: “The hotel lived up to all previous highly recommended reviews”
Reviews.Author: Rackenford
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean the staff were friendly and polite. The breakfast was amazing and the swimming pool was a delight. The Zoo really is opposite and behind the bus tour starts behind the hotel. There is an excellent Chinese restaurant adjacent to the hotel who were happy to accommodated the fussy eater in our party. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “New Destination”
Reviews.Author: PremierGlobalTravel
Reviews.Content: I usually stayed in the Interconti in Berlin (last year 3 or 4 times). My stays are usually 7-10 days. Destiny had it that I couldn't book the InterConti all the way through in February. The hotel was sold out on the weekend of the Berlinale. Rather than switching hotels I decided for the Palace. As I am always careful with new hotels I booked a Deluxe Room which is comparable with the standard or superior rooms at the InterConti. While there were minor problems (mostly with Internetaccess) it was pleasant enough to try the Business Suite for my second leg of my March trip. The Business Suite is essentially equal to the InterConti Club rooms (in size). The 5 star rating is well deserved in every aspect. The staff is pleasant and friendly. Service is very good. The Palace definitely has won me over. A couple of minor issues: the TV in the business suite is way to far away from the bed. I suggestion is to put a second smaller TV on the little dresser which functions as a separation between living room and bed room. Or move the TV closer. The other minor issue: use one of the mattress tops to overcome the split in a double bed. Overall I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMI54
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palace is a perfect choice for a luxuriuos stay in Berlin. It is located next to the Zoo Station. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was a little bit small but excellent cleaned. The nice little gift present was a really good idea. The breakfast buffest offers a large quantity of food and beverages. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe room is very spacious”
Reviews.Author: kir1970
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel for a long weekend . Breakfast was very good with a huge choice - shame the coffee was warmish & never hot ! The hotel is close to ' Ka De We' which is Europes largest department store - fantastic if you love to shop & like the nice things in life . The restaurant on the 7th floor is well worth a visit & the deli on the 6th floor is huge . The ground floor is handbag heaven !! There's a lot of building work going on in the city , virtually every street - not noisy just messy looking ....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Lovely Service!”
Reviews.Author: jpaScandanavia
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Hotel Palace Berlin for a 2 night getaway and it was a perfect choice. Everything was just lovely, The room, breakfast, location, etc.etc. The staff were really very nice and could not have been more positive and helpful. All and all a perfect hotel for a visit to Berlin. FIVE STARS for sure!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Stevecho
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed an excellent stay at the Hotel Palace . The location is very good also . The service, food and whole experience was really very good . The rooms were very comfortable . Highly recommended .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: jesann
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located between the Zoologischer gardens and Kurfustendamm. On our arrival at the hotel they told us they had given us a room upgrade as our original booking was a basic room. The room was very nice and comfortable with complimentary robes and slippers. It was very clean, warm and quite large with a sitting area. The bed was turned down by housekeeping in the evenings with some nice touches. On the down side the hotel says their rooms are sound proofed - this one was not as you could clearly hear the activities of other guests! Also for some reason they replaced the kettle on day two and the replacment appeared to have soap in it causing havoc when it boiled. The toilet would not stop running when it was flushed and the shower was not the best although it was a seperate unit from the bath. Finally you could only see half the TV screen if you were in bed as it was obscured by a wall. The hotel had a beautiful pool with a built in spa at one end but both were very cool. The sauna was an extra charge. Internet charges were 10euro for one hour (17e for the day) - rather steep just to refresh your I Pod !. The lobby was very pleasant - a nice place to sit with good bar service. The reception service was excellent and friendly as was the breakfast area. Our room rate included breakfast and it was superb with good choices. On checking out we were charged for mini bar usage - this was a mistake and rectified without question. Cases were left on the last day in a secure area. All in all a very nice hotel in a good cosmopolitan location adjacent to great shops and a reasonable choice of various restaurants Berlin has an excellent public transport system and the hotel is close to three U Bahn stations one of which is on the main line from the Shonefeld Airport. Buses 100 + 200 which go via lots of tourist spots on route to the old East Berlin also stop almost directly outside the hotel. Just a note - our preffered train back to the Airport was cancelled anouncements only in German and it was difficult to find out what had happened. Berlin is not a great city for foreign languages for the tourist although It appears English is better than most others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: AutoGen
Reviews.Content: Berlin's U-Bahn is great and Palace is located nearby the Zoologischer Garten, which makes it a perfect starting point for most Berlin adventures. We stayed one night in a Deluxe modern double room. Big room, big bathroom and big windows. Room was clean and include all the neccesities including a water boiler, which is great for those late night coffe breaks. You can choose from a wide variaty of pillows and blankets. We were asked by mail some days before check-in. Palace offers very good service, discrete and never intrusive. They will go a long way to make you're stay as pleasant as possible. Enjoy the wide spread Breakfast buffe, squeze your own fresh orange juice and enjoy the services provided by the staff. We booked three weeks in advance and got "early-bird" discount and paid 160 Euro, breakfast included. I.m.o. very cheap for a hotel of this standard!

Reviews.Title: “Great "1st time in Berlin" stay”
Reviews.Author: mayj
Reviews.Content: Check-in prompt. Stayed in a newly renovated room. Right across from the zoo! Shopping and LOTS of restaurants in both directions. Near the subway. Conference facilities were amazing and they work with an incredible AV company. Tour buses starting location just behind the hotel. Staff was attentive and pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Good, affordable 5star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hellboy_20_10_10
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel. The breakfast was good and the staff are very friendly. A clean atmosphere with facilities like sauna, gym also at quite lowprices. The hotel is moderately prices comapred to other 5 star hotels in the vicinity of the area. May be that is due to off-season during my time of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent throughout”
Reviews.Author: Tanumz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this 5 star hotel. The rooms are great (we even got a free upgrade) with all the kind of service you expect in such a hotel. The breakfast is outstanding with a wide choice. The service is very good. Nice little pool with gym. At extra cost sauna and massages are available. Location is excellent, walking distance to S-bahn, U-bahn and a number of buses, K'damm, Savygnyplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vegemite_kid_10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived after spending a night in an unsuitable hotel, we'd booked online through Wotif or something similar and got a really good price. The door staff were helpful and welcoming, as was the receptionist who checked us in. They were fantastic, couldn't do enough for us. No request was too much trouble. Their First Floor Michelin star restaurant was nothing short of fabulous! My daughter was celebrating her 19th birthday and had never experienced such service or quality of food. Her desert was delivered with a "Happy Birthday" written on the plate, I was surprised at how the staff had known but apparently one overheard us talking and told the chef. It was a lovely gesture and made a memorable dinner an unforgettable one! I could go on forever about this hotel but suffice it to say, the rooms were beautiful, clean, comfortable, and spacious and the buffet breakfast was wonderful, stocked with anything practically your heart (or stomach) could desire for breakfast, including cake! Location was great, right opposite Berlin's excellent zoo. Easy walking distance to most other places and efficient public transport. Not excessively expensive, and worth every Euro!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel, great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: ceebeee
Reviews.Content: agree with all the other excellent reviews of this hotel. Staff friendly and helpful, breakfast amazing, rooms clean and well fitted out, (we stayed on a 34oC day and airconditioner was amazing. Quiet and kept room super cool. Hire bikes next door for €15 each for weekend, and see all of berlin. Make sure you go to the beer garten in TierGarten (Café am Neuen See, Lichtensteinallee 2, 10787) its about 600m away behind zoo directly opposite and is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taxideftis21
Reviews.Content: Great location (next to bus stop of lines 100 and 200), close to the Zoo. Big, clean and quiet rooms (we stayed end of December-January), nice breakfast. Friendly and informative staff. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fredriksam
Reviews.Content: Me and my dad did a travel to Berlin. I visited the Berlin Zoo and many more places. I had read that this hotel was the closest to the zoo. This hotel has everything that makes the stay great. Nice personel that say good morning at the morning and a really great breakfast room. The parking are a bit pricey but the car is safe from breaking in which is good. The room was very nice with good air conditioner. Very good pillows in the bed and no noise from the street outside. All in all. Very good hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jaeme
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Berlin - fine and kindly service, close to city

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel but needs improvement in service to guests”
Reviews.Author: Inescarlos
Reviews.Content: I and my husband don´t speak English very well but is enough to make tourism and make check-in in the hotels but in this hotel I felt some impatience by the staff.We arrived in Berlin by car and we were stressed and tired and the hotel´s staff made us felll worse.We had a reservation for transfer to the airport and we asked the concierge to call it confirms and the answer was the call was paid, a local call, only to confirm the reservation,luckily the company called us and left a message in Spanish confirming the booking. The room is big, very clean and beautifull, also the bathroom. The breakfast is wonderfull. I think the hotel, even though a majority of guests to work, shall deliver a differentiated service to tourists. When we travel, I and my husband, like to feel in the hotel as home and that was not how we feel in this hotel, we need persons to help us and guide us and we didn´t find it there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yaron_h
Reviews.Content: a very good city west side hotel, nearby you can find the luxuries shopping area as well as conferrable public transportation to the Mitte area. The room was a superior room and was large and very comfortable (no view from the window but we didn’t come for hotel view). Hotel services are reasonably priced for Europe and the hotel offers good selection of services and excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good but expected more for the price”
Reviews.Author: Navytravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip. Great location with good routes for taking a run, nice gym and pool. In the morning they put out water and snacks for people returning from a workout...nice. The breakfast is also excellent. Staff is nice but it took me two days to convince them that the AC in my room did not work - it was consistently 27C. Finally they gave me another room - a nice upgrade. Charging 10E a day for internet also not appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: verey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for me and my sister. it is near the bus station, near the big shopping street and the breakfast was good and tasty. I hope to visit and stay here again. regards Vered Yehezkel

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: edjjharris
Reviews.Content: a nice hotel which you would expect for the price - good gym and pool. The room was quite dark though with no view and internet access was expensive. Food and service were good and good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Valmor
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights. Very nice place, centrally located with excellent facilities and service. Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not value for money”
Reviews.Author: MosEkaterina
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellently located (1 min from kaider wilhelm church, 5 minutes from KaDeWe), but I found it not value for money at all - pricey for '80-style furniture and window exiting the grey walls.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lesterlad1
Reviews.Content: What a superb hotel in a fantastic location. Went for 2 nights for the Christmas markets. We were in a standard room that overloked the zoo and this room was lovely. The staff at the hotel were knowledgable friendly and professional. They could not do enough for you regardless of the time. Only gripe that I have about the hotel is that the cost of drinks at the bar are very expensive 2 half pints of beer cost 10.80 euros. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful and would recommend the Sparkling wine. Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, well situated and friendly staff plus great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: MattPaisleyScotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well appointed and in a fairly central location. The rooms were spacious and the breakfast excellent with staff very friendly. The spa area was fantastic and provided a very welcome rest after touring the city. Unless you are on business I would advise leaving the mini bar alone as it is very expensive. Overall, we had a great stay and would visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location to tour berlin”
Reviews.Author: ajjcummins
Reviews.Content: 6 of my family members stayed here for 3 nights in december 2009. couldn`t fault the hotel on rooms or decor. i requested an early check in for my parents which was granted ( and upgraded too). the location is brilliant to explore berlin. the hotel is right on the ku damm just 5 minutes from zoo u bahn station so its excellent for shopping and transport connections. we were visiting berlin for christmas markets and sightseeing and both were on our doorstep, the kaiser willhelm bombed church which was surrounded by the city christmas market so location was 100% perfect. the hotel was expensive to eat in but there are loads of restaurants around to suit all pockets. its my second trip to berlin and would recommend it to any one and this hotel is best location.... the earlier you book the better the price. its also a very safe and clean city.... our irish cities could take a leaf out of their book

Reviews.Title: “a classical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrJosepa
Reviews.Content: A classical business hotel. Staff was not as proffessional as expected. Luggage room was occasionally unlocked and unattended. Customers could go in and out to take and put their luggages without any strain. I don't feel safe with my stuff. Bellboys were not helpful, and we couldnt find them when there are needed. Hotel has two towers and the rooms on the second building (which is actually the higher stairs of the neighbouring shopping mall) are hard to reach and lots of halls to pass. No elevators on that wing of the hotel. Nothing to say about rooms. Perfect. Beds and pillows were the softest things i have ever slept in my whole life. Just across the zoo. Walking distance to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was really appreciated by all the group where the service and clenliness were top class”
Reviews.Author: GooseBono
Reviews.Content: Location is spot on if retail therapy is required but for a gang of lads with alternative entertainment requirements it is probably a bit remote. However its also opposite the Zoo so if you are that way inclined its perfect too. Overall though a very positive experience and would definately recommend the Palace to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars? - hmm”
Reviews.Author: JEB456
Reviews.Content: Generaly nice Hotel but I am disapointed with the equipment in the room and the view. - Very old and poor TV set with a very bad TV signal. - Broken Internet equipment, antenna on the tabel set was broken. - From the windows you are looking directly into a wall on another building.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfy and friendly, but extras could hurt your wallet”
Reviews.Author: shaunyweston
Reviews.Content: This is a review based on staying in the hotel's 'deluxe' room, which we were upgraded to on our arrival. Our room was lovely – very clean and comfortable. The weather outside was hot, so we were appreciative of the air conditioning (3 levels). The bed was comfortable and the furniture was all very nice. The bathroom was clean and tidy, and there was decent shower gel and soap. There's loads of room in the deluxe room, so you're never short of space to put things. The maid service, particularly on the first day, was great. They seemed to make an extra effort to fold loose clothes and put them on the bed, and they even put a cuddly toy that we took on our trip on top of the pillows (see photo). The spa facilities were OK – the pool was quite cold, and the attached Jacuzzi was also quite nippy. Gym equipment was available to use, but you have to pay extra for the sauna and massage treatment room. Overall, extras were expensive, such as breakfast (€29 per person) and WiFi access. That's right – there's no free WiFi at the hotel! Also no DVD player, radio, etc. The hotel is really rather nice, but I would suggest it has a four-star rating for the lack of 'extras' that make a trip feel special. I can't fault the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Knoedeltester
Reviews.Content: we where on a midweek package and were really pleasantly surprised about the hotel, service and ambience. the porter greeted us by name when we arrived by car...this you find seldom. Food outstanding at the first floor...but pricey. The journey to the room was rather long and they had no bellboy on hand so we had to drag our luggage through the endless seeming corridors. Also the view onto another roof and the back of other buildings was not nice...but hey, you don't go to Berlin to look out of your window. Overall a very impressive hotel...we liked it and will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: Palace is the only private run big 5 star hotel in Berlin, situated adjacent to the Europa Center, just a few moments from the shopping street of Kurfurstendamm and the Kadewe Department Store, as well as the Kaiser Wilheim church. Despite its size, the Palace manages to feel personal, and this is of course because of its efficient and kind service; even before arrival, all our requests were answered instantly and with kindness. Upon arrival, we were shown to our suite, the Zoo Suite, which was extremely spacious, and an exceptional value for the rate paid. Bang & Olufsen televisions and audio equipments, a big dressing room, a guest toilet, and one of the biggest bathrooms we have ever encountered in a hotel room complete with a jacuzzi and its own TV and audio units are some of the aspects of this suite. Its design may not be minimal nor old world, but they were some tasteful touches, and the room was in excellent condition, and certainly not out of date. Breakfast had a great variety and standard turndown service was a nice change from big hotels that have it only upon request. All in all, an excellent property, it may not be a boutique hotel, nor an old grand one, but it certainly is one of the best properties we have ever stayed at, and certainly deserves its Leading Hotels of the World status.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - as always.”
Reviews.Author: Bod_Norway
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Palace Hotel was as good as the last time we stayed there. Everything is top. Perfect location, service, breakfast, spa and room! We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviewer that the hotel is an excellent choice in terms of value for money. Stayed in the hotel for a night and paid 159 eur. Service was good, room was large, bathroom included a jacuzzi and a separate shower, a welcome bottle of red wine and small treats were waiting in the room. However, the furnitures in room looked like if they were from the (horrible) 80's and the decoration was not that inspiring either. I had dinner in the michelin-starred restaurant First Floor; all in all worth of its 1 star. I also stayed during the same trip in Ritz-Carlton (see other review) which does not provide as good value for money although it's more 5-star in terms of service and rooms than Palace Hotel Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: momokoko
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the centre, close to sights and shops. Good service, good room, good breakfast. No complaints at all - except: W-Lan not free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ravn007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Hotel in Berlin. We got a good offer - 90 euro a day for a very nice double room with nice views. And including a very gode and wide breakfastbuffet. Can highly recomend the hotel - if you got an good offer.

Reviews.Title: “Travel broadens the mind: It can change it too”
Reviews.Author: gulfmanUae
Reviews.Content: At an age that is too embarrassing to reveal, this was my first proper visit to Germany...and what an experience! The service was quite outstanding, from the amply-staffed reception, to the porters, the restaurant and bar staff and the housemaids. Where was all that cold, ruthless order one had been brainwashed into expecting? Efficient , certainly, but always with good humour and a genuine wish to please. What a pleasure and made for such a good atmosphere throughout this lavishly appointed, uber comfortable hotel. If you are ever lucky enough to stay at the Palace (remember to ask taxi drivers for the 'Hotel Palace' (if you say Palace Hotel they look a bit vague for some reason) and do three things. Visit the Spa, which has excellent excersise facilities; make it down to breakfast on the second floor - everything you can imagine on offer and more - a day's feast on its own; and have dinner in the first floor. This is the not so imaginatively named, but utterly delightful, award-winning restaurant located on...yes, you guessed it. Okay, it is the sort of place where if you have to ask the price, you are probably better off at KFC round the corner. But the food is exquisite and the wine list must be one of the most extensive in the culinary world. You have to try one of the beauties that never, or rarely, find their way beyond the border. Heaven in a glass. Trying to find fault, as I was settling in, there was an irritating buzzing in the room that appeared to be coming from behind a locked door beside the bed. Aha, got them! Luckily, before I could rush down to complain in triumph, it became apparent that the noise was in fact coming from one of my suitcases. Who invented the electric toothbrush anyway?!

Reviews.Title: “Average luxury hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Roel2
Reviews.Content: We booked the palace for a weekend trip to Berlin. As the hotel claims 5 star status and charges the corresponding steep rates one would expect a perfect stay. Unfortunately, they do not live up to this status. On arrival at the hotel our room was not ready yet. The front desk staff offered us a complimentary drink in the lobby bar while they arranged a room assignment. Unfortunately, the drinks -- two mineral waters and a red wine -- were charged to the room, and no-one seemed to remember the fact that drinks were offered complimentary. Upon entering our assigned room, a nice newly renovated room, I was under the impression that their was a length issue with the bed. I realized later on that we had probably been mistaking, but at the time we were convinced that the room did not have a 200cm bed, but a 190cm version. Being almost 2m long, that is a real issue. We talked about the issue with the front desk staff and were assigned a different room. I was disappointed with the smoke odor in the second room which was also present in the sheets and mattrass and is the main reason for me to rate the overall hotel experience as negative. The rest of the hotel is nice and clean. The lobby is quiet nice, the spa has a small pool and connected whirlpool area as well as a gym. The first-floor restaurant serves great food but it didn't give us that great feeling that we have experienced in other michelin-star restaurants, one of being pampered with perfect food, service and atmosphere. The breakfast restaurant is ok. One of the chefs however did need some practice baking eggs and omelets.. Internet and valet charges are high. All-in-all, this is a nice 4-star, but definitely not up there with the great 5-stars. Also, this hotel is in the West-Berlin centre, which is /not/ the center of Berlin as was mentioned in a previous review. Shopping in Berlin has moved to the Friedrichstrasse area ever since the fall of the wall. This is the old East-Berlin centre which is a few miles from the Palace hotel. If you are looking for a true 5-star luxury hotel in Berlin you should have a look at for example the Adlon, Ritz, Regent or Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Discriminates against Asians”
Reviews.Author: Dungdang
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small and loud noise coming from utilities. Requests to fix problems were ignored. Hallway stank of Urine. Strange for a 5 star hotel, they seem to have rooms at the IBIS-Accor level. Small, old carpets, etc. A friendly email informing the staff about the shortcomings of the hotel were denied as never happened and added with the insult "If you felt discriminated against, please don't come back".

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Fearghas
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was just outstanding. I was really exhausted from work when I checked in and just wanted to sleep. And that's what I did - nobody bothered me or came near me and I was just left to sleep all night and well into the afternoon the next day. The room (in the newer part of the hotel) was trendy, modern, comfy and luxurious with robes and slippers provided. The bathrooms were huge and well appointed and there were loads of TV channels. There was no mini bar which I thought was a bit odd so I ventured down to the lobby bar which was nice but extremely expensive - there's even a luxurious smoking room with a big TV. The room service menu isn't very extensive but the food was delicious and the service warm and friendly. I really just wanted to hibernate in this hotel as I was tired from a long business trip and I'm so glad I chose this place. Everything you could want is on your doorstep - the location of this hotel is second to none. There's two city centres in Berlin due to the former east/west divide and this hotel is in west Berlin which I found a nicer place to be with more to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. Room was not ready to check in at 3.00pm. I was asked to return later and was then upgraded to the top floor. My stay was faultless and would certainly be returning when next in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not quite 5-star”
Reviews.Author: Empathology
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night package booked through Hotels.com and my impression is of a very good 4-star hotel but not quite 5-star. Nothing too specific but it didn't have that extra something that you expect from 5-star quality. The staff in particular seem desperately to please but don't seem able (or are told not) to think outside the box and go that extra mile that 5-star really requries.. Previous reviewers are completely correct that this is a very central hotel and whilst there's Berlin's finest shops on the doorstep, there's little by way of quality bars and restaurants nearby. Indeed the closest restaurant is a KFC. Overall, this isn't a great hotel - but neither is it bad. There's plenty of good reasons to stay here: the rates seem excellent in comparison to other 4 & 5 star centrally placed hotels; good pool & spa; centrally located;; and others. If they just removed that 5th star that they're clearly very proud of from their logo, I'd be writing a much more favororable review!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: BURFORDLOVERS
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to stay....and for the price....I would say fantastic. The service, facilties, rooms, cleanliness, location, staff, service, food....brilliant. The buffet breakfast is well worth getting up for and taking your time over. Dont be put off by the exterior look...There are better ''five star'' hotels in the world - yes - but for the price and location you cannot fault it at all....well done Palace Hotel!!! TIP - Have a Mojito cocktail in Sam's Bar...the BEST I have ever tasted....

Reviews.Title: “Never take the first room”
Reviews.Author: GoldenBeetSalad
Reviews.Content: I met some friends in Berlin and stayed the first night at the Palace Hotel - primarily because it is one of the few central Berlin hotels with a swimming pool. To women travelling alone -- never take the first room you're offered. The Palace was a perfect example of this. I booked one night through Hotels.com (even so, not inexpensive) and they put me in the worst room in the house. Not only was it miniscule and cramped in every way, but it stank of stale cigarrete smoke, dingy, tired and peeling wallpaper - no view, no air. It was gross. I called the front desk and asked to see a different room - and they showed me an out-dated junior-ish suite. At least it was a clean, non-smoking room with some space. Later, my mother-in-law explained to me that they keep rooms like the first one they showed in many European hotels for the hired help - a chauffeur or nanny who may be travelling with a wealthy family. She hypothosized that because I was a single woman, travelling alone and that I had booked online, they assumed that I would be docile or something, and take the first room that I was offered. That said, the swimming pool really was beautiful (though a bit small) - with wonderful scenes painted around it - and the upgraded room a relief - sheets were clean and the room was good enough. Overall, the people were kind, the lobby is fun to sit in, and the experience was ultimately worth the price that I paid for it. Travel Note: I did ask the concierge for dinner recommendation and he sent us off to a restauraunt that was on a back street and had OK German food, but certainly wasn't a winner. Clearly a case of the kickbacks. Kickbacks are fine as long as the restaurant is great or hard to get into. Lesson learned: When staying at the Palace, pick your own restaurant. Don't ask the concierge to do it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: phl-kc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and would not advise it for people with other options. Room was decent size for a European hotel but there were also many negatives. Furnishings were dated and floors were dirty. The hotel phone system was down for three days. Staff was rude. The front desk tried to charge me an extra day that I had cancelled upon check-in - this was a 30 minute hassle. The location is okay for but for better restaurants and sight-seeing, stay closer to Postdamer Platz or Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service minded”
Reviews.Author: SooLux
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in the hotel to attend a conference. The first thing which appealed to me is the very central location of the Palace Hotel...it is really in the hart of Berlin (next to the shopping street and next to the parks). This is a huge advantage when one is attending a conference. The hotel is not "brand new" or "very design"...but it is not outdated or looking old either. Just say it is not the hippest place in town. The service however is simply perfect; the staff does its best to make your stay an unforgettable event, all of them are so friendly, we really enjoyed this. What I really enjoyed is the breakfast buffet.....a large selection of fresh fruits is part of it...even buttermilk is available. They have different kinds of tea. I looked forward every morning for the breakfast experience in this hotel. (they have a choice of 5 free newspapers 3 German ones and 2 in English at your breakfast table). The SPA was also very nice, they have a finnish sauna next to the iglo room where you can cool down. The swimming pool was nice as well and there's enough space on the SPA terrace to relax and have a drink. They know how make you feel well. As usual in Northern Germany, you can go nude into the sauna and the adjecent public showers (but not at the swimming pool). The temperature of the sauna was "à point" and the herbs they use gave a pleasant smell. The only minus is that you need to pay an additional 7€ to use the sauna (but not the swimming pool, which is for free) Our room was perfectly cleaned up every day. They send in a "controller" to check the work of the cleaning staff. Again, the staff is very friendly Our room was very large and spacious, I enjoyed it For me an internet connection is important. They offer wireless and LAN internet...the quality was "broadband" as well the price...I don't see why one has to pay 88€ for a week., I don't need to put coins in the shower even to get it working :( I was very pleased with the overall and outstanding quality of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel service but with few flaws”
Reviews.Author: DahlFamily
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Palace Hotel in Berlin. The location of the hotel is right on Kurfürstendamm and very close to the Zoo and Gedänknich kirsche. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms after recommendation from Tripadvisor. This was a good recommendation. We had a direct view over the zoo and to the Fernsehturm. The room is modern and has a good size. The beds are rather hard. The hotel has a high standard: There is a good pianoplayer in the bar area at night. The service from the staff is more than excellent. They certainly live up to the standard of "The leading hotels of the world". The only minus is the additional costs. Internet Connection is rated to 22 Euros per night which is very high. The prices in the bar are approx. 50% more expensive than in a restaurant. The pool area is fantastic but the pool was rather cold and we therefore only used it once. You have to pay to use the sauna area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sriser
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The personel were all fluent in English and very helpful. The room was very up to date and comfortable. Not huge, but large enough. Luxurious bathroom with separate tub and shower. Outstandint breakfast included in our rate. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Just gets better”
Reviews.Author: Obermoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year just the two of us and had a fablous time 5* great staff not stuffy made us feel very special. This year took all my family, 10 of us including 2 two year old nephews, the boys had toy mooses and child toiletries in there rooms. Special breakfast table for all 10 of us. No snooty looks when the boys were a bit noisy. If you want something special stay here it is one of the best

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EalingMember
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons why there appears to be a difference of opinion regarding the star rating for this hotel is possibly because the hotel is made up of two distinct blocks. Half of Palace Hotel has been renovated recently and consists of contemporary landings and bedrooms/suites. The other block (directly above the main entrance) is still trapped in the 1970's time warp that's been mentioned by previous contributors. Unfortunately I ended up in the latter half! Whilst the room was indeed large, clean and functional it lacked the finishing touches that one expects from 5-star accommodation. The service at the hotel was reasonable, though I did find the concierge to be particularly unhelpful. However one of the redeeming features of the Palace Hotel is its location. The hotel can be reached from Tegel Airport by catching the X9 or slower 109 bus and getting off at the last stop (Zoologischer S+U Bahn). Close to the hotel are the 100 and 200 bus routes which pass all the major tourist sites - a far better option than taking a tourist bus. The hotel is situated in the only area of the city that has not seen major redevelopment in the past 20 years. However it is in close proximity to the major shopping street (Ku’damm) and other tourist attractions (e.g. the Zoo, Aquarium, Kaiser Wilhelm Church, the Ka-De-We Dept Store). If you are going to be making use of the fantastic public transport across Berlin, then this hotel is an ideal (though slightly expensive) base from which to explore this amazing city. The Restaurants in the hotel are okay, though if not eating in the hotel I would advise you to look further a field as the restaurants/café’s close by are not particularly good. The exception is the 7th floor restaurant at the Ka-De-We. The health facilities in the hotel are good, though the swimming pool was a bit short for my liking. However the staff is helpful and provide you with towels, dressing gown and sandals (to avoid you slipping on the floor). The spa facilities are also nice but cost an extra €7 per day. For those looking for things to do whilst in Berlin, I would highly recommend the walking tours offered by Original Berlin Walks (Discover Berlin) and Sandemans New Berlin (Red Berlin Tour and the Free Tour). The Reichstag Dome, TV Tower at Alexanderplatz, and Pergamon Museum are all worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: DoctorToxic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly anonymous from outside. Lobby & bar look very impressive, but a pianist is not to everyones taste! Long narrow corridors and a poorly lit standard room, adequately spacious but very comfortable bed. Furnishings were outdated & looking slightly worn; very poor view. Bathroom was clean but really needs updating (very 1980s). Breakfast was not included but was good & reasonable value at E24. Staff were very friendly & efficient, tho the evening 'turndown' service was a bit unneccesary & ocassionally annoying. All in all not to everyone's taste and expensive for the quality of room. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but surrounding area looking old”
Reviews.Author: markpx
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. The hotel is well run and very friendly, if a little expensive. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff - try the pillow menu! The Spa on the third floor was excellent. We found Sam's Bar to be very pleasant (although expensive) for a late drink or meal. Breakfast was not included. We tried it a couple of times but it was expensive - however the service was excellent. Our room on the 6th floor was enormous. The decor was a little dated. The bathroom had a bath and separate shower. There were two twin beds connected together to make a double - this was not very comfortable and let the room down, somewhat. The room can get a little noisy if you leave the windows open - but not with the traffic noise, the animals in the famous Zoo, that is close by, get a little boisterous it seems! The Zoo S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations are very close and ideal for central Berlin and for excursions to Wannsee (pronounced Vannzee) and Potsdam (Sans Souci is a World Heritage Site and worth spending at least a day there, but make sure you also visit the "Forbidden City" where the KGB had their German headquarters). You can walk from the hotel to the very pleasant Tiergarten, although take a one-stop trip on the S-Bahn if you like. Buy a day ticket that covers all travel on the S-Bahn and U-Bahn - although check which areas it covers. You can get week tickets but they end on a Sunday so not of any use to us. The S-Bahn and U-Bahn are excellent. The local area has lost much of its charm since the Wall (and the government handouts) stopped. The Europa Centre which is next to the hotel is one of the earliest shopping centres in Europe and you can tell. We found good restaurants surprisingly difficult to find. Overall a good relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Standard room bathroom more like 2 star”
Reviews.Author: roscaber
Reviews.Content: If you go to this hotel don`t book a standard room. The room was ok but the bathroom was tired and in need of refurbishment. The shower was in the bath with the shower head hooked up. This swivelled about when turned on, making it difficult to stand under. There was no thermostat, just a hot and cold mixer tap. I had a nasty fall when the shower suddenly became very hot. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: pariswestlondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights and has been very happy to have chosen this hotel. Services, room, breakfast have been top class!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycmiguelito
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. Staff is friendly and they speak english fluently. The rooms are very clean and comfy, including beds and pillows. We are a gay couple and felt welcome here. The concierge suggested a boat trip ( a must do when in Berlin) which we loved and a Mozart concert at the Schloss Charlottesburg. The hotel location could not be better. Right In the middle of town a few steps from the U-ban, the Zoo, the Ka-De-We, the Europa Center, and the best shopping area around. Not far from gay mecca either. The breakfast room is amazing and service is impecable. If you can afford it... don't miss it. You are going to love it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lobby piano”
Reviews.Author: iceland84
Reviews.Content: When i was there it was so cold out side in the night time but the big room´s with good heating keep´t me and my friend hot all night , the lobby was great and the piano palyer was magnifisent that playd for the guest´s in the evening , The pool and the massasge expiriens was like heven i have never sleept so good in my life after the spa and masasge the first floor resturant suprised me they had water from all over the world but not iceland where im from , but i orderd the norwegian water, the food there was amazing with allot of taste :D manny thanks to the staff that was wonderfull and helpful with infromation about every thing

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: tobee888
