Reviews.Content: Just back from the Palace today.What a beautiful hotel, with efficient,friendly and helpful staff.We booked a standard room at a great price on the web and were delighted when we arrived to be upgraded to a suite on the 9th floor which you could only get to by using your room key in the lift.This made it really special as the trip was for our 30th wedding anniversary.The hotel is very central(the number 200 bus stops right outside and the Zoo is directly across the street) We flew into Schoenefeld airport and bought a ticket for the train in the newsagents in the arrivals hall.It is about a five minute walk from the airport to the railway station and a 35 minute journey to Zoologischer Garden station,then about a five minute walk to the hotel and costs 2euros 10 cents.Due to our flight time this morning we decided to take a taxi back to the airport,which cost 30 euros.The breakfast in the hotel is amazing,even serving smoked salmon and champagne(if that's to your taste) and it was nice at night to go back to your room to find the bed turned down,the TV turned round to face the bed with the TV guide and remote control on the bedside table and your slippers sitting waiting at the side of the bed.All these little touches make it a very special hotel to stay in. There are so many places to see in Berlin and a long weekend is certainly not long enough-you could spend two days at the shops alone!!Great bargains to be had at this time of year as all the shops have sales-some with 50% reductions. One thing I would avoid is the hop on,hop off city tour.At 20 euros each this was an absolute rip off.Yes you can hop on and off,but if you want to go back to say stop number 2 after you get off at stop number 5,you have to get back on the next bus that comes along to stop number 5 and go all the way round again as the tours only go in one direction which can take nearly 2 hours.It is much easier (and cheaper) to buy a day ticket for 6 euros and jump off and on the number 100 or 200 buses which pass all the sight anyway. Definitely a hotel and city to be recommended-can't wait to go back and see more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: bristolreviewer
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Palace in May 2007. It is a very high standard of hotel. We had a superior room booked via the hotel website, with breakfast included, for €180 per night. The room was spacious and well-equipped, with a kettle and tea/coffee, plenty of wardrope space, separate shower and bath. Service was speedy and exemplary. We dined at the First Floor one evening - it is a great experience, with wonderful tastes to be explored (not cheap, but worth doing once). The hotel is handy for Zoo station, with links across Berlin, and has plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The spa is OK, but around the corner in Nurmberger Strasse, try the wonderful Thermen am Europa instead - a large roof top spa, with excellent treatments and plenty of space to sunbathe it is about half the price of the Palace spa. There is a friendly, if pricey, late bar at the Palace which is a comfortable place for a nightcap. Overall, we would definitely return to this deservedly five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel, more than excellent”
Reviews.Author: fredis
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time at this hotel for two nights. Also i stayed in other hotels in Berlin at the same qualification. Overall, a very outstanding hotel. I can absolutly recommend this hotel. Very good choice, that you pay and what you get !! 1. The location: in the west of Berlin, perfect to travel in the whole city. 2. Reception: a very welcome, very friendly. 3. Room: very spacy, everything you need is in the room, looked very clean and up-todate. 4. Bar: not so big, but felt very well, also very nice staff, looked always after the guests. 5. Breakfast: special room that for, very spacy and so much choice, excellent quality. not used: first floor restaurant and spa (you are in Berlin, you are not in a resort hotel, as Berlin has so much to offer).

Reviews.Title: “yes' yes 'yes!!”
Reviews.Author: jockster
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel palace for three nights at end of feb. i have never stayed in a more beautiful, relaxing, spotlessly clean hotel in all my years of traveling. every thing about this hotel is perfect..brilliant staff, excellent location, great room/bathroom...we were given a free upgrade to a deluxe double at no extra charge!! if you're thinking about staying here i highly recommend.. do it! book it now you wont regret!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAR43
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at quite a few hotels in Berlin and rank this as pretty good. Its very close to the UBaan and S Bann so you can pretty well get anywhere in Berlin from here.The 100 Bus stops just outside the door and will take you to the key sights (Brandenburg gate etc. Buy a day pass as this will make life easier and save you from lugging around a pocket full of coins. If shopping is your thing then its all just moments away. The rooms were clean and big (ish) with the best shower I've ever had in Europe. The only down side is that the bars in the hotel lack any real character or ambience. The Bistro is sometimes a bar sometimes a restaurant and even if there's nobody eating, woe betide you if you just want a drink..... Still all in all excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the food”
Reviews.Author: Dovndyr
Reviews.Content: Great and almost cheap hotel by lhw standard. Loved it and made me relax totally, with its nice big deluxe rooms and ok madras. The breakfast was exelent and would love to come there any time again

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a leading hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PurpleAlbie
Reviews.Content: I have to say I disagree with many of the prior posts...perhaps my standards are different? We stayed for the weekend at the Palace Hotel Berlin. We chose this hotel because of the location (near shopping) and because it is a member of Leading Hotels of the World (LHW). Having stayed at other LHW properties (including the Adlon in Berlin), I'm not sure how the Palace made it into their membership list. If you are looking for a basic business hotel (a la Radisson or Sheraton), then this is probably a good choice. As other reviewers have posted, the rooms are large by European standards, clean and nice, and it is a plus that the bathtub and shower are separate. Convenient transportation is close by, as is shopping. However, this is definitely not a luxury hotel. The amenities (hand soap, mouthwash, shampoo, and body wash were all) are hotel brand, and sickly-sweet smelling to top it off -- not what I'm used to from LHW. We were looking forward to room service our first night, and while it was nicely presented, we were disappointed at the few main course choices on the menu, and they forgot to bring napkins, so we had to use kleenex. We had booked a King Deluxe through the hotel, and our room had two 90x200 beds pushed together to make a king size...not what we expected. To make matters worse, the rooms were very hot, and the air con apparently is turned off for the winter. We couldn't open the window because our window was right next to some equipment (too noisy). Worst of all, the mattress was covered with a plastic liner (for hygenic reasons, we were told), so we sweat all night. Fortunately, the front desk was able to move us to a different room with a regular king bed on a higher floor the second night; sleeping with the window open was a bit more comfortable. Going to Potsdamer Platz one evening, I asked at the front desk (there was no concierge present) for nearby dining suggestions, such as a nice German restaurant. The front desk clerk (who'd been there all weekend), informed me that there were lots of restaurants, but her only suggestion was the chain steakhouse Maredo...not very helpful. She also directed us to the bus stop, but failed to inform us we'd need coins to pay, so we missed the bus while we returned to the hotel for coins. Definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vice Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1mermaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Hotel during the holiday season. The lobby was so beautifully decorated and we were just mere steps from a fantastic Christmas market. You are a very short walk from some of the best shopping and very close to the U-Bahn/S-Bahn, which made it very easy to get around. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. The breakfast was absolutely fantastic, though I will have to say the restaurant was a bit dated. Our room was spacious for a European room and the bathroom was very well appointed. Everything is spotless and we had a very nice stay. I would certainly stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: traveller55555
Reviews.Content: This is a nice 5 star hotel, but nothing special. It is not a historical palace or a grand hotel, but just a boring 5 star business hotel. Exterior is extremly ugly, but the rooms are quite nice, although too modern for my taste. Hotel has superb service and very good choice of amenities in the room and bathroom, also the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: EJH20
Reviews.Content: What a hotel I can honestly say this was the best hotel i have ever stayed in. The service was superb right from the front door. The spa area was great we used the reflexology + sauna + massage + pool- it was all spotless there was never a problem getting towels + toiletries etc. The rooms were immaculate v. well serviced, beds turned down at night, slippers set out + any thing used in the bathroom during the day was replaced. Bathroom spacious, bath with shower + separate shower aswell. Breakfast amazing everything on offer you can think of including sparkling wine ( not the best in the world but v. nice with a drop of freshly squeezed orange juice). Nothing was ever too much trouble for the front desk staff + they were v. good at giving help with directions + various little bits of advice re: transport etc, umbrella on offer if wet to borrow. Location excellant for transport to sights + shopping + eating out lots on offer. I would recommend a day trip to Desdan - trains super + quite resonable, also if time permits a trip to SACHSENHSN concentration camp you can cover the camp in a half day- very very moving. So if I return to Berlin I would definatly stay at the Palace Hotel + would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone. We booked through kudammhotels.com + got the best rate with breakfast included. One other tip we got a taxi from the airport on arrival but from then on we used the s+u bahn + it is so close to the hotel it will save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: manzana
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find fault with this hotel (but I have!). When we arrived late (thank you Air Berlin) the reception was cheerful and helpful. We had booked a double room and this had a sofa and two easy chairs, superb bathroom with shower and a bath big enough for two and really comfortable beds. There wasn't a view from the room (except over a naturist health club) but we were out most of the day. The hotel has an excellent spa area with a hot sauna, cold room and tepid room as well as a seperate ladies sauna cabin. The relax area was good enough to stay in. This costs an extra 7 euros. Included in the room rate is a good sized swimming pool with loungers. The staff here were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was excellent with an enormous choice arranged buffet style. Most mornings I had an creamy oaty cereal followed by smoked salmon and scrambled eggs and then a bowl of fresh fruit. They never minded that I started with a pot of tea and finished with a coffee. There was an area set aside for smokers at the back of the room so the rest of us were OK. But the breakfast room is where I found fault. One day a lady was allowed to bring her dog into the breakfast room and more seriously there were no guards over the food to protect against coughs and sneezes. The location of the hotel was excellent too. Within a couple of minutes there were two U Bahn stations and the best bus routes for the 'sights' passed by the door. Two recommendations to add to those in other reviews. We took the walking tour of Potsdam and had a fascinating and well informed tour of the town and palaces. The guide was an American student in Berlin and really on top of the information. We also found an excellent vegetarian restaurant in Kreuzberg called Cafe V. Having lived in Brighton I can say that only Terre a Terre beats it and then not by much. It isn't in the most salubrious area of Berlin but we never found Berlin a threatening city. if you haven't been - go. And stay at the Palace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, loved it, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: gtakiuk
Reviews.Content: I wanted a romantic break with my husband, so arranged to leave my children with my mum, and escape to Berlin, so booked a 3 night stay in Hotel palace including flights from Expedia which cost £200 pp, so it was a very good price indeed. But as the kids were on their half term, they decided they wouldn't want to stay with their granny and prefer to come with us, so I contacted Expedia to upgrade my reservation, and they wanted to charge me £275 for the room only!!!! So I contacted the hotel directly, and they were happy to accommodate them for free! So I only had to pay for their airline tickets. So in case you get in a similar situation just contact the hotel directly. My trip wasn't romantic after all, but the hotel was fantastic, as we were a family of 4, we were given a giant room, with a big bathroom, that has a shower and jaccuzzi tub, the toilet was seperate. I loved everything about the hotel, the staff were very efficient and professional. Don't expect an over the top lobby like in some 5* hotels, but the rooms are fantastic. The spa on the 3rd floor is good, the swimming pool is small and quiet, the changing rooms are very clean, everything about the hotel is clean. You're provided with hotel towels in the swimming pool so don't bother taking yours. The hotel is right in the centre of K'damm, the main shopping area with lots of shops and restaurants, this is my second visit to Germany, and my first to Berlin, but I absolutely loved the Germans and intend to go there every year. The zoo and garden opposite the hotel is a must if you have children, it's nice. Also sightseeing tours is a must also to take you around the main landmarks in Berlin. Don't expect to find bargains in the shops, but the food and drinks is cheaper than England. I would definitely go back to Berlin and stay at Palace hotel again, as I absolutely loved its service and location. If you've booked to stay there, then you've made the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: jomito
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Palace Hotel for two days in July. The service was excellent in every respect. The location cannot be beat. As I had children in tow being located across the street from the Berlin Zoo entrance was extra appealing. As most of Europe was suffering from an oppressive heat wave, we were able to cool off in the superb indoor pool. Only steps away from the KaDeWe department store, a 10 euro cab ride to Check Point Charlie and 15-20 minutes by cab yto Tegal airport. Every staff member in th hotel went out of the way to be accommodating. 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good Location - Beautiful Hotel - Excellent Room and Great Breakfast Very Good Service and Welcoming Staff

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palace Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Budapesterstrasse 45, 10787 Berlin, Germany
